title: Synthetic Recap
body:
TORONTO — On a night where the final score painted a picture of a defensive struggle, one man authored an offensive masterpiece for the ages. Rookie sensation Tracy McGrady, in just his fourth professional game, erupted for a stunning 25 points off the bench, single-handedly carrying the Toronto Raptors to a breathtaking 93-92 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers.

While Lakers star Shaquille O’Neal dominated the paint with a monstrous 28-point, 13-rebound double-double, and Kobe Bryant added 18 in his own youthful display, it was the other 18-year-old who stole the show and snatched the win. McGrady’s performance was not merely productive; it was historic, injecting pure electricity into the fledgling Raptors franchise.

The game was a nail-biter, with neither team able to pull away. But every time the Lakers threatened to build momentum, McGrady had an answer. He sliced to the rim, hit from mid-range, and played with a poise that belied his experience, providing the crucial scoring punch his team desperately needed. His 25 points were not just a team-high; they were a statement.

In the final, frantic seconds, with the score tight and the arena holding its breath, the Raptors clung to their one-point lead. A last-second attempt by the Lakers clanged off the iron, and the horn sounded. The victory belonged to Toronto, but the night belonged to Tracy McGrady. His explosive coming-out party announced his arrival to the league and gave the Raptors a legendary, hard-fought win they would not forget.
